context: Mom calls on Sundays. You're at your desk.

start.speaker: Mom
start.text: Hi sweetie! Are you eating enough? Your father is making the turkey this year. He watched a YouTube video. I'm scared.
start.internal: (She calls every Sunday. You pick up every third one. She pretends not to notice.)

choices.text: Hey Mom, yeah I'm eating fine. Tell Dad to use a thermometer this time.
Hey Mom — sorry, can I call you back? I'm just finishing something up.
choices.internal: (You won't call back. She knows you won't call back.)

choices.text: Mom, I've been meaning to ask — is Dad okay? He seemed off last time.

turkey_advice.speaker: Mom
turkey_advice.text: Oh he bought three thermometers! One for each... I don't know what the other two are for. Anyway, are you coming home for Thanksgiving?

choices.text: I'll try, Mom. Work is just really busy right now.
choices.internal: ("I'll try" is the adult child's "we'll see.")

call_back.speaker: Mom
call_back.text: Oh! Of course, honey. You work so hard. I'm so proud of you. Call me when you can. Love you.
call_back.internal: (The voicemail she'll leave in 4 hours will be 6 minutes long. You'll listen to the first 30 seconds.)

dad_concern.speaker: Mom
dad_concern.text: Oh, Dad's fine. You know how he is. He doesn't... he misses you. He won't say it. He reorganized the garage twice last month. That's how I know.

choices.text: Tell him I'll call him this week.
choices.internal: (You might actually do it this time.)

try.speaker: Mom
try.text: Okay, sweetie. I understand. Jordan's coming. They ask about you, you know. ...Anyway, I should let you get back to work. Love you so much.

commit.speaker: Mom
commit.text: Really?! Oh that's wonderful! I'll tell your father! He'll — oh he's going to be so happy. He won't say it but he'll clean the guest room. That's how you'll know.

end_call_back.speaker: Narrator
end_call_back.text: She'll call again next Sunday. And the Sunday after that. The streak of missed calls will hit 4 before you pick up again.

end_dad.speaker: Mom
end_dad.text: He'd like that. He really would. Okay, I'll let you go. Don't work too hard. ...Who am I kidding. Love you.

end_visit.speaker: Mom
end_visit.text: Oh honey... that would be so nice. Your room is exactly how you left it. I dusted it last week. ...I dust it every week. Okay, I need to go before I cry. Love you!
